Description: Black granite figure of a seated falcon on a pedestal behind a deeply incised cartouche containing the nomen of Ramses II. An incised inscription on the front of the pedestal names the god Ra-Horakhty. The sides and back of the pedestal are uninscribed. The state of preservation is good apart from the beak which has been broken away. There are no traces of colour.
